item.description:
This gathering is happening at the closing of Shavout. This is the most important event in Jewish history, in fact, the event where Jewish history began: the receiving of Torah. We will celebrate it with festive food, and we will talk about the meaning of Shavout.

For more about Shavuot, please see my FB page http://www.facebook.com/miriam.e.daniel

If you're not on FB, here is the best insight on 'What is Torah': http://www.chabad.org/library/article_cdo/aid/1426382/jewish/Torah.htm

and wealth of resources on Shavuot http://www.chabad.org/holidays/shavuot/default_cdo/jewish/Shavuot.htm

We will learn about some basics of Kabbalah fundamentals and about methods of Jewish meditation, and will try some applications of it. Our approach will be to combine theory with meditative practice, as much as we can, and integrate new information with spiritual and sensory experiences. Judaism is a religion which is very much involving our bodies, and meditative practices of Jewish mysticism are also intended to be applied and experiential.

What your right hand may have to do with your excessive giving-in, or in contrary, with your tendency to judge. What happened in your lifetimes that may be affecting the state of your body. What is the balance of forces, and why is it vital. What is 'mindful heart' and how we achieve the state of heart-mind connection.

Goal of our Kabbalistic studies and meditations is always to bring ourselves closer to Creator. We understand this as 'ascending the Jacob's ladder', step by step evolving to our higher selves, actualizing our potential and connecting 'heaven and earth' through our own personal transformation.

Looking forward to seeing you soon.

Love -- Miriam
